title: Investment scams (too-good-to-be-true returns)
summary: Investment scams promise big returns but aim to steal your money. They can use fake platforms, fake testimonials, and pressure tactics.
how_it_works: You’re offered a ‘high return’ with little/no risk.
Scammer pushes you to deposit money into a platform or wallet.
Withdrawals get blocked unless you pay more fees/taxes.
warning_signs: Guaranteed returns, time pressure, or secret ‘VIP’ groups.
They ask you to pay more to withdraw your own money.
what_to_do: Check if the provider is properly licensed/registered and be cautious of ads.
Never send money just because a platform shows ‘profits’.
If unsure, stop and seek independent advice.

quick_quiz.q: What’s the safest way to get to the real website?
choices: Click the link in the message
Type the website address yourself or use the official app
Reply and ask them for another link
quick_quiz.explain: Scam messages often include links to fake sites. Typing the address yourself (or using the official app) reduces that risk.

quick_quiz.q: A message says you must act 'within 24 hours' or you'll lose access. What should you do first?
choices: Stop and verify using official contact details you find yourself
Forward it to friends to ask
quick_quiz.explain: Urgency is a classic pressure tactic. Verify using trusted contact details.
